column1: All Peninsular Malaysia Candidates names are either derived from August and October 1974 government gazettes mentioned in the metadata. The Sarawak 1974 Candidate names are derived from Penyata Pilihan Raya Umum (Dewan Rakyat dan Dewan Undangan Negeri), Tahun 1974, Suruhanjaya Pilihan Raya
EC does not have accurate values for total Independents losing deposit for 1974 State Elections
New Straits Times, 26 August 1974 states Oran has additional PSRM candidate though no evidence found in government gazette
Oran PSRM candidate of Amin bin Ishak may have an alternate name called Bakar Arrifin
Perlis Candidates requiring more verification for sex category
Evidence for Ahmad Awang as PAS candidate is lacking
Anak Bukit candidate of Cu Mid Padang Hang may have an alternative name called Hamid bin Talib
Kedah Candidates requiring more verification for sex category
Party affliation of Ab. Rahman bin Haji Yahya requires more verification
EC have contradictory value of Binjai electorate of 2624
EC have contradictory value of Merchang of 2907 and this impacts total ballot issued
EC have contradictory statement that Mohamad bin Abdul Rahman (Chukai) is a PSRM and Independent Candidate
EC  does not have accurate total rejected vote value for Trengganu
EC does not have accurate total ballots issued for Wakaf Mempelam (claiming it is 5259 votes)
Trengganu Candidates requiring more verification for sex category
EC does not have accurate value for total PSRM votes of Pulau Pinang (claiming it is 13496 votes)
EC have contradictory value for DAP candidate of Pengkalan Kota (one says it is 1534 and another says its 2434)
Sungai Pinang (Pulau Pinang) Independent Candidate Mohd Hamid Merican pulled out the race
It was understood that there was only one female candidate for Penang State Elections
EC have contradictory value for Changkat Jering (Perak) for total electorate (claiming it is 14858)
EC have contradictory value for Bukit Gantang (Perak) for total electorate (claiming it is 11753)
EC have contradictory value for Belanja (Perak) for total electorate (claiming it is 13311)
Missing Independent Symbol information for Kelian Pauh (Perak) Independent Candidate Ng Hoe Hun
Sum of total electors of two DUNs under Batu Gajah does not align with total electors of Batu Gajah parliamentary seat
EC has contradictory value for DAP candidates losing deposit for Perak
EC has contradictory value for KITA candidates losing deposit for Perak
Allocation for Chong Chien Chang to Gerakan is based on understanding that Gerakan was allocated to two DUN seats. Requires more verification
Vote Value for PSRM candidate for Bukit Gantang is an estimate

Allocation of Pahang DUN seats to Barisan Nasional for Jelai, Bukit Betong, Benta, Tahan, Tembeling, Kerdau, Beserah, Sungai Lembing, Batu Talam, Dong, Chenor, Chini, Rompin, Mentakab and Bera requires more verification
EC had wrong turnout percentage for DUN Chenor (Pahang) (claiming it is 79.1%)
All Candidate values for DUN Jenderak are an estimate
